meanings.definition: Duffed (verb): past tense of duff - to hit or throw something clumsily or inaccurately
meanings.sent1: He duffed the ball and it went way off course.
meanings.sent2: She duffed the paper airplane, causing it to crash into the wall.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician duffed his card trick, making the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The pitcher duffed the throw, sending the ball flying over the catcher's head.
meanings.sent5: The golfer duffed his swing, sending the ball rolling into the rough.

meanings.definition: Duffed (adjective): of poor quality or in bad condition
meanings.sent1: The duffed toy broke easily because it was poorly made.
meanings.sent2: The duffed book had missing pages and torn covers.
meanings.sent3: The duffed umbrella flipped inside out in the first gust of wind.
meanings.sent4: The duffed car sputtered and stalled on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The duffed phone screen was cracked and barely functional.
